LocaleResource.Name: AdminInstruction
LocaleResource.Value:
To configure this plugin navigate to the respective product for which you want to define prices based on customer roles and define the prices in the tab group prices.

Product Groups

By managing your prices via product groups, you can save a lot of configuration effort. Enter the prices for a product group here and define only the corresponding item group ID at product level.

Import

To import records for this plugin, do a normal import Admin > Configuration > Import. Select the ID field as the key field. The file to be imported must contain the following fields
ID, DP_ItemGroupId, DP_CustomerGroupId, DP_LanguageId, DP_StoreId, DP_CustomerNumber, DP_Price, DP_CalculationMethod
You can download an example file here.

LocaleResource.Name: CustomerRolesForProductCost.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Here you specify the customer roles for which the purchase price of products is to be calculated.

LocaleResource.Name: HideTierPrices.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify here whether tiered prices are hidden if alternative prices have been defined.

LocaleResource.Name: ApplyTierPriceAsBase.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify whether the tiered price is to be used as the basis for price calculation if a tiered price with quantity 1 is defined for the customer group of the customer.

LocaleResource.Name: CustomerRolesForPriceSupression.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify the customer roles for which no price is to be displayed if no criterion has been set for this customer role.

LocaleResource.Name: ProcessVariantCombinations.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Determine here, prices of attribute combinations are processed, if an adjustmen or percentage adjustment has been set for the product.

LocaleResource.Name: AddNewCriteria
LocaleResource.Value: Add a new criteria or update an existing one

LocaleResource.Name: ItemGroupId.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: With the group item ID, the product can be assigned to a product group for which price dependencies can be stored globally in the plug-in configuration.
